intro: Anemopaegma goyazense, commonly known as the Goyazense Anemopaegma, is a rare flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
